author: Reuters Editorial
title: BRIEF-Woolworths Says 26-WK HEPS Down 15.0% To 206.3 Cents
text:
Feb 22 (Reuters) - Woolworths Holdings Ltd:
* ‍GROUP SALES FOR FIRST 26 WEEKS OF 2018 FINANCIAL YEAR INCREASED BY 2.5% TO R38.8 BILLION​
* ‍26-WK EARNINGS PER SHARE, WHICH INCLUDES BOTH IMPAIRMENT CHARGE AND LAST YEAR‘S PROPERTY DISPOSAL, DECREASED BY 246.6%​
* 26-WK ‍HEADLINE EARNINGS PER SHARE DOWN 15.0% TO 206.3 CPS​
* ‍INTERIM DIVIDEND PER SHARE DOWN 18.4% TO 108.5 CPS​ * 26-WK ‍ADJUSTED DILUTED HEADLINE EARNINGS PER SHARE DOWN 8.8% TO 223.4 CPS​
* 26-WK ‍RETURN ON EQUITY RISES TO 20.1% FROM 22.8%​
* ‍IN SOUTH AFRICA, TRADING CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN CHALLENGING IN SECOND HALF​
* WOOLWORTHS - ‍IN AUSTRALIA, GROWTH AND CONSUMER SENTIMENT IS ALSO EXPECTED TO IMPROVE SLOWLY ON BACK OF IMPROVING ECONOMIC INDICATORS​ Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage: (Bangalore.newsroom@thomsonreuters.com)
